Implement email format validation.

Authentication fails for non-existent email addresses.
Passwords must be compared using hash values.

Passwords must be stored using bcrypt or equivalent/stronger algorithms.
Hashes must include a salt.
Plain text passwords must not be output to DB, logs, or responses.
Passwords must be at least 8 characters long.
Configurable rules for combinations of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols.
Password input fields must be masked.
Account lockout after 5 consecutive failed attempts.
Lockout duration is configurable (Initial: 30 minutes).

Unlockable only by administrators.
Security logs generated upon lockout events.
Brute-force alerts for excessive attempts from a single IP.
Issue a JWT upon successful authentication.
JWT must contain user_id, role, and expiration date.
JWT must be signed.
Token signature verification is mandatory.
Invalid or tampered tokens must be rejected.
JWT expiration is configurable (Initial: 60 minutes).
Tokens must only be transmitted over HTTPS.
Secure attribute must be set when using cookies.
HttpOnly attribute must be set when using cookies.
SameSite attribute must be set.
CSRF protection tokens are mandatory.
Anti-session fixation measures must be implemented.
Use parameterized queries/ORM against SQL injection.
Sanitize input values (Anti-XSS).
Store logs for successful logins.
Store logs for failed logins.
Logs include user_id, IP, User-Agent, and timestamp.
Logs must be stored in tamper-evident storage.
Log retention period must be configurable.
Apply rate limiting to the login API.
Return HTTP 429 when rate limit is exceeded.
Authentication process must support asynchronous I/O.
Target response time for login API is within 200ms.

Login state maintained until token expiration.

user_story.action: I want to authenticate into the Business Management System using my secure credentials

Email format must be validated against standard email regex patterns.
Corporate domain restrictions must be configurable, allowing administrators to specify which domains are permitted for authentication.
Authentication must fail and return a 404 error for non-existent email addresses.

Password comparison must utilize constant-time algorithms to mitigate timing attacks.

Password input fields must be masked to prevent shoulder surfing during entry.

Locked accounts must not be able to authenticate until unlocked by an administrator.
Security logs must be generated for each lockout event, detailing the user and timestamp.
Brute-force alerts must be triggered for excessive login attempts from a single IP address, with configurable thresholds.
Upon successful authentication, a JWT must be issued containing user_id, role, and expiration date.
JWTs must be signed using a secure algorithm to ensure integrity and authenticity.
Token signature verification must be mandatory for all JWTs to prevent tampering.
Invalid or tampered tokens must be rejected with a 401 Unauthorized response.
JWT expiration must be configurable, with an initial default of 60 minutes.
Tokens must only be transmitted over HTTPS to ensure secure transmission.
Secure, HttpOnly, and SameSite attributes must be set when using cookies to enhance security.
CSRF protection tokens must be implemented and validated for all state-changing requests.
Anti-session fixation measures must be enforced to prevent unauthorized session hijacking.
All database queries must use parameterized queries or ORM to prevent SQL injection attacks.
Input values must be sanitized to prevent XSS attacks before being processed or stored.
Logs for successful logins must be stored, including user_id, IP address, User-Agent, and timestamp.
Logs for failed logins must also be stored with the same details as successful logins.
All logs must be stored in a tamper-evident storage solution, with a defined method for verification.
Log retention periods must be configurable to meet compliance and business needs.
Rate limiting must be applied to the login API to prevent abuse, returning HTTP 429 when the limit is exceeded.
The authentication process must support asynchronous I/O to improve performance under load.
The target response time for the login API must be within 200ms under normal load conditions.
Error responses must not reveal internal system information, such as stack traces or database details.
Transition to business screens must only occur upon successful authentication, with the specific screens defined based on user roles.
Initial screen branching must be based on user role permissions, clearly defined in the system.
The login state must be maintained until the token expires, with automatic logout upon expiration.
Tokens must be invalidated upon user logout, with invalidated tokens managed via a blacklist stored in Redis.

issue_detection_list: The exact regex pattern for validating email format is not specified.
The specific configurable parameters for password rules (minimum number of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special symbols) are not defined.
The exact claims and their formats for the JWT are not explicitly defined.
The distinction between when to return a 404 error for non-existent email addresses and a 401 error for invalid or tampered tokens is unclear.
There is no explicit mention of authorization rules detailing who can access what resources after authentication.
There is no mention of data encryption for sensitive data or personally identifiable information (PII) handling.
The expected behavior for invalid email formats and the specific error messages for various failure scenarios are not explicitly stated.
There are no explicit negative test cases defined for scenarios like invalid tokens or failed logins.
The acceptance criteria do not specify the system messages that users will see during failed logins or successful authentications.
The redirection logic after authentication is vague, lacking details on which specific business screens users will transition to and how they are informed of their next steps.
The criteria do not define how users are informed of progress or state changes during the authentication process.
